{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's age and the description of the lesions as brown, greasy, and appearing on the forehead are indicative of seborrheic keratosis. This condition is common in older adults and is characterized by such skin changes. Melanoma would typically present with more irregular, potentially multi-colored lesions and is a more serious condition. Acanthosis nigricans is usually associated with insulin resistance and typically presents as dark, velvety patches in body folds and creases. Erythema nodosum presents as painful, red nodules, usually on the shins.", "answer_choice": "B. Seborrheic keratosis"}
